quote_first: There’s a big, old-fashioned clock in the surgery. Just as Dr. Wellesley went out I heard the Moot Hall clock chime half-past seven, and then the chimes of St. Hathelswide’s Church. I noticed that our clock was a couple of minutes slow, and I put it right.“ When did you next see Dr. Wellesley?” “At just
quote_last: .” “Where?” “In the surgery.” “He came back there?” “Yes.” “How do you fix that precise time–eleven minutes to eight?” “Because he’d arranged to see a patient in Meadow Gate at ten minutes to eight. I glanced at the clock as he came in, saw what time it was, and reminded him of the appointment.”
title: In the Mayor's Parlour
author: J. S. Fletcher
